Assessment.QuestionText: Can you type the code to display different departments, using the <font face="courier new">TreeView</font> control, in the left pane, and the <font face="courier new">ListView</font> control in the right pane?
Assessment.CorrectAnswer:
TreeView tvwEmployees = new TreeView();
ListView lvwEmployeeDetails = new ListView();

tvwEmployees.Nodes.Add("Departments");
tvwEmployees.Nodes[0].Nodes.Add("HR");
tvwEmployees.Nodes[0].Nodes.Add("Marketing");

lvwEmployeeDetails.Location = new Point(150,0);
lvwEmployeeDetails.Size = new Size(250,100);
lvwEmployeeDetails.View = View.Details;
lvwEmployeeDetails.Columns.Add("Name");
lvwEmployeeDetails.Columns.Add("Designation");
lvwEmployeeDetails.Columns.Add("Qualification");
lvwEmployeeDetails.Columns.Add("Experience");
